content.description: Just left of Berry Dazzle.  Nothing special, but we're still thankful to have fun moderates to play on.
content.protection: 5 or 6 Stainless bolts, chains with steel biners
content.location: Second route from the far left.   Slightly up left from where the approach trail encounters the rock.

content.description:
Unlike most of the other routes in the area,

Sunfish

has some deep pockets and fun edgy face moves, especially for the first 3 bolts.  Enjoyable sequences.
content.protection: 6 Stainless bolts, chains with steel biners
content.location: On the main face, third route from the right.  Right of the black water streak.

content.description: Sassy off the first bolt for sure!  Tough start through some great edge sequences as it pulls the starting bulge.   The wall eases up towards the middle and top, but its still fun climbing.   Definitely want to stick clip this one!   Angles up and right at the first bolt.   If your really want, you can toprope an easier version out left off the anchors but we didn't clean it.
content.protection: 7 Stainless bolts, chains with steel biners
content.location: Not counting FILO (on the opposing wall), this is the 4th route from the right and near the black water streak at the upper part of the cove.  There is a final set of stairs that takes you up to this and the other routes at this part of The Cove.

content.description: This route has a clear crux at the first bolt, and relaxes for the rest of the climb.  Be sure to stick clip.  The name is a cryptic reference to BD.
content.protection: 5 Stainless bolts, chains with steel biners
content.location:
A few feet left of

Apprentice

at the right end of The Cove.  Climbs through a low roof near the start.

content.description: This easier route catches shade around 2pm.  Pretty fun climbing for the grade.
content.protection: 5 Stainless bolts, chains with steel biners
content.location: Furthest left route in The Cove.   Up the hillside to the left from where the approach trail encounters the wall.

content.description: A little sugary in a few spots, so we kept the bolts a bit too close for mental comfort.  It was well cleaned and  will end up being a decent route but as with all Maple climbs (especially new routes) be a little cautious of anything potentially loose.
content.protection: 10 Stainless bolts, chains with steel biners
content.location: Right side of the "Wave" roof in the middle of The Cove.   Climbs up into the roof.

content.description: Putting up new routes means long hard days and heavy packs.  Dust in your eyes, scraped knuckles from cleaning, sore arms from whacking away loose cobbles, and a hole in your wallet from stainless bolts.   Most days we found ourselves the first ones in the parking lot and the last ones out...  thus the name FILO (First In Last Out).   This route faces west and keeps the shade a bit longer in the morning, but also keeps the sun longer in the afternoon than the other routes at The Cove.
content.location: Far right end of The Cove.  The only route on the adjacent right wall.   Starts on some giant dinosaur sized cobbles and works up to a steeper crux at mid height.  The upper third is easy but leads to nice views and pleasant climbing.

content.description: This is a long and varied route that lets the climber enjoy a decent sized roof at a moderate grade.  Not too many 5.10 roofs like this around.   Climbs giant cobbles and easy but fun terrain until it reaches the "wave" roof.  Pull straight out the roof to a good hold at the lip, pull the lip and clip the chains.   Named after a landscaping purplish stone that this route resembles.
content.protection: 11 Stainless bolts, chains with steel biners
content.location: The first route encountered from the approach trail.  Its the relatively flat, dark, and smooth face that prominently climbs out from a low point at the base of the wall.

content.description: Juggy fun.  Easy warm up.  Cool pockets at the 2nd bolt.
content.protection: 5 stainless bolts, chains with steel biners.
content.location: Furthest right route on the main face, just left of the deep corner/slot.   FILO is just to its right.

content.description: For the first ascencionist opening up a new crag, it's always exciting to see your first Customers play on the routes.  We created these places for people to enjoy, and seeing the happy faces, whether it be a beginner on a new 10 bolt 5.5 or the veteran looking to add another 5.12 to their tick list.  Sharing with Customers is the best part.
content.protection: 10 Stainless bolts, chains with steel biners.
content.location: In the middle of The Cove.  Look up.  See the "wave" roof that caps the wall?   The route skirts just right of the roof and has anchors at about the same height as the top of the roof.
